name: Marriott Shoals Hotel & Spa

reviews.title: Awesome Hotel and Staff
reviews.text: First, let me admit that I never hesitate to complain about a hotel, or any other business. Rarely do I submit a review with laudatory comments about a business unless they go way out of their way to accomodate an unusual request.

reviews.title: Not a 4 Diamond as Advertised
reviews.text: My wife and I were on a motorcycle trip which just happened to fall on her birthday. So, I wanted to surprise her by planning something special on the road. I contacted the hotel staff to make the reservation, which was fairly simple on the internet and I listed some information about my plans. Well, nobody contacted me.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: When I called and got the front desk about a week later, they put me in touch with Kim Tittle. She was fabulous. I asked her to get me some flowers sent to the revolving restaurant, have some balloons and happy birthday decorations. I had one request that I thought she could not pull off -- An Atomic Cake. Most have never heard of it... She told me it would be no problem. I was amazed but skeptical.

reviews.title: horrible anniversary package trip
reviews.text: When we got to the hotel, the rooms were beautiful, the hotel was spotless, and they had a great pool that reminded me a little of a pool we swam in at Cancun. The 360 restaurant is a great revolving tower where you can eat dinner and see the scenery in every direction. The food is UNBELIEVABLE... There is a food and wine pairing menu that will absolutely floor you! GET IT!

reviews.title: The service is pretty much pathetic.
reviews.text: Well, my wife says the surprise with the flowers and the balloons was awesome, but when the atomic cake came out she couldn't believe it. She has not had her favorite cake for over 8 years since we moved from Chicago. Oh yeah, champagne and chocolate strawberries in the room. This hotel is probably one of the best experiences we have had in a long time.

This hotel is lovey, the grounds are family friendly and well maintained. The nightly entertainment in the lounge is such a nice touch. This property has it ALL, a wonderful, caring and polite staff that will do ANYTHING to please the guests. I can hardly believe that anyone would complain about one single thing here! I ate at all the 360 grill and the swampers, both had EXCELLENT food at a resonable price. A+++ to Marriott, this is a lovely place to stay and the staff goes out of thier way to make the guest feel special. Added BONUS, there is a SPA on site, a little pricey, but worth it! Thanks to ALL....I think I love Brian in Swampers! LOL
reviews.title: Wonderful Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband stayed at the hotel for our anniversary it was a nice hotel but the noise was so bad from the bar we could not sleep we were right above the bar and we even asked to be moved and were refused we even thought about just leaving and going somewhere else but we tuffed t out and will not return was a very bad night.
reviews.title: No sleep here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Marriot Shoals the night of our "couple only" wedding. When I made the reservations, i mentioned that we were getting married that day. it was liek the entire staff knew and they went out of their way to make our stay special. The room was beautiful and the view great. The staff was the friendliest that I have ever met and were very quick to respond when we called. The breakfast buffet in the Bronzeback Grill was terrific. The next night, we ate at the 360 Grill- it was expensive, but well worth it! The food was spectacular and the view was amazing. My new hausband and I loved this hotel and we will be going back!
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff made Wedding Night VERY Special

reviews.text: The first morning alarm clock was left on from the prior guest and woke us up at 6:45 AM (we are not morning people). The second night we were there the water from the air conditioning unit was dripping really loudly so we called to get it fixed. We had to call twice, because it took so long for someone to come up to our room. Then the only remedy was for us to move rooms and maintenance said that still would not guarantee that the new room would be drip free. So, he suggested turning the air up to 73 degrees. Our room was then stuffy, and we could still here the dripping. After we finally got to sleep, we were woken up, by someone placing the bill under our door and knocking at it at 5:45 AM. We were also still amazed that at the price we paid, there was not free high speed internet offered. We got complimentary slow internet, but it was faster using my iphone's wireless network. We come to this resort a couple of times a year, but after this experience, I doubt we will be back again.
reviews.title: After many pleasant trips, we were very disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read some previous reviews about this hotel and was alittle sceptical at 1st, but I was very happy once we arrived. The staff was very friendly and everything was beautiful. The room was very clean and we loved the balcony view. I would recommend staying on one of the higher floors in order to fully enjoy the view of the River. Some trees may block the view on the lower floors. Overall it was a Great Stay and we will definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay
Wow!!!!
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for over the Memorial Day weekend. We loved it!!! We had a room on the 5th floor with a view of Wilson Dam-Only problem was there were some trees in the way. Our room was large with a balcony, comfortable bed and large bathroom with separate tub and shower. Room service was good, the lobby bar was was great, with live music and bartenders knowledgeable about the area and can give some insight to where the locals eat and drink. We enjoyed the indoor and outdoor pool and hot tubs.

reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay at Marriott Shoals.
reviews.text: The only con is you get nickle and dimed-50 cents for a local call, fees for valet parking, service charge for room service.

reviews.title: Goof Facility - Marginal Service
reviews.text: Plan ahead if you want to use the spa-they prefer 2 weeks in advance.

reviews.title: Nice Night
reviews.text: Overall this was a great place to stay for a relaxing vacation, there are more things to do in the area than one would think. We're gonna have to come back to do more sightseeing, and will definitely stay here again!

reviews.title: Missing something?
reviews.text: This was our second stay at Marriott Shoals on a spring break golf outing with three other couples It is a very nice facility and in a great location on the river. I enjoyed my stay here and I look forward to a return visit. .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we found ourselves in Florence, I was excited to have such a nice option for lodgings. The rooms and bathrooms are unusually large and comfortable, and the public spaces are outstanding. The revolving restaurant on top of the tower is great fun, although the food is a bit inconsistent and overpriced. The pool area also looked nice, although we came out of season. My biggest complaint is that the staff fell down in lots of small ways -- for example, when we went for a cup of complimentary coffee, the dozens of boxes of tea on display proved to be mostly empty and no one seemed to care when I reported it. Similarly, although there was a doorman on duty at all times, he spent most of his time chatting to other staff members and never seemed to notice when you actually needed a hand to get your luggage through the door. Since we stayed for free on Marriott points, I can't complain too much -- but I certainly would think twice about paying for a room here.
reviews.title: Not quite as good as I expected

reviews.text: Stayed at he Marriott for a retreat. Even with a group rate the rooms were very expensive. Breakfast was catered by the hotel and was very pricey for the food that was served. Check in was slow and confusing. Staff was not polite. Did have a spa treatment that was nice.
reviews.title: Horrible service for HIGH price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Florence for our anniversary, as this is where my husband and I met. We have stayed at the Marriott in Florence before so we were prepared for a fabulous stay. The rooms are perfect, the hotel is clean and the views are worth the stay. The pool is where it's all happening in the summer. Lots of folks were out socializing and soaking up the rays. There was always a musician either in the bar or out by the pool (which kind of got on my nerves after a while).We were stunned by the lack of service we received however. 1st nite, we had friends meet us for dinner at one of the restaurants on the hotel property. We sat outside and were promptly forgotten, literally. After about 20 minutes waiting for our waiter to take our order ( and it was not crowded in the restaurant at all) we had to go ask for someone to wait on us. It was a slow and painful process. Same in the bar afterward. We only got one drink and gave up. The next day at the pool, a server came by around lunch and said she would take care of us for the day. After getting a coke and a tea, we tipped big in hopes it would ensure she got by to wait on us often. it didn't work. She never came back. My husband walked over to where she was and placed an hour, which we never got. We ended up getting our own drinks at the bar. We vowed never to return and we won't. I've stayed at many Marriotts across the country, but this was the worst service ever. We are not lazy, service snobs. We're middle America folks who only want what we pay for. If service is important to you, I would discourage you staying at this hotel.
reviews.title: Super hotel, not so super service

reviews.text: This hotel is very nice great service,clean and super friendly. My husband works in AL and stays at this hotel everyweek so we joined him for 2 weeks our girl's ages 12 and 6 loved it pool is amazing!!! Trust me you won't be disapointed:)
reviews.title: Excellent!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Just about everything was great with this hotel. Lets start with the only 2 complaints-- no one ever asked if we needed help with luggage but did smile as we struggled by. Also wi-fi cost 10 bucks , a bit much but at least they had computers in lobby for free. Now to start with the pool-loved it, inside and outside(couldn't bring your own drinks poolside but they sold them, this can get very expensive if with large family). The room was absolutely beautiful with a balcony overlooking the pool. The bar happy hr was great and we enjoyed a bit of food as well and it was delicious. The surroundings was gorgeous, from landscaping to waterfall. Like the fact they had free local or small fee for shuttle bus. I will definitely stay here again!!
reviews.title: So very lovely

description: The sophistication and charm of this unique Florence hotel will be matched only by the natural beauty of its resort-style setting: * Located in the state’s northwest corner in Florence, Alabama * Nestled along the award-winning Robert Trent Jones Golf Trail * Set in the heart of the Tennessee River Valley, one hour from Huntsville * Less than two hours from Birmingham, Nashville, and Memphis
